DataElement.preferredName: Patient Satisfaction with Cancer Care 9 After Most Recent Visit Knew What Next Steps of Care Would Be Agreement Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated agreement about whether they knew what the next step in their care would be after their most recent visit, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Satisfaction with Cancer Care Questionnaire After Most Recent Visit Knew What Next Steps of Care Would Be Agreement Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed measure patient satisfaction with cancer care. It is designed to address: 1) satisfaction with care during screening and treatment, 2) challenges of poor and minority individuals receiving cancer-related care, and 3) relevance for evaluation of care for both navigated and un-navigated patients. The questionnaire is usually administered within 3 months of screening and again 3 months after the initiation of treatment._Happening after a patient's most recent visit._A response indicating that an individual knew what the next steps in their care would be._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

The questionnaire is usually administered within 3 months of screening and again 3 months after the initiation of treatment.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (Strongly Disagree) to 5 (Strongly Agree) on a 5-point Likert scale._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: PSCC (Patient Satisfaction with Cancer Care Questionnaire)

ReferenceDocuments.name: I knew what the next step in
ReferenceDocuments.description: I knew what the next step in my care would be.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: PSCC: Patient Satisfaction with Cancer Care Questionnaire; Pascal et al., Cancer, 2011 February 15
